oil with which words are eaten
used as auxiliary to indicate future action

plant; sow (certain specific) seeds - kiio olea = sow maize seeds
knock or strike a hole through an object; punch a hole through; break open - kiipuo ya = break it open

English: knock or kick something from its stand; knock down

English: (Owere) how; the manner in which - Kpa ahu o rimma? = that manner
column3: is it right? O wii kpa o jiri mee = that's how it happened

English: behave; act in a particular manner; conduct oneself

make money; Lit: gather together or collect money or wealth
cut (a man's) hair; plait (a woman's) hair
be needed; be urgent - o di mkpa = it is important; it is urgent; o fir m mkpa = I need it urgently

English: dive or swoop down (as a kite does)
be repulsive to sight or touch; give one cold shudders
be narrow; be tight - kpaa akpa = be very tight; be tight-fitting
converse; chat - kpaa nkata = converse; chat. var. kpai
cut; trim - kpaa isi = have a haircut; constrict; hem in
gather; collect - kpaa akwukwo nri = collect/gather (vegetable) leaves; kpaa ilgwo = collect/recover debts
knit; weave - kpaa ute = make (weave) a mat; plait - kpaa isi = plait (women's) hair
raise; breed - kpaa eghu = raise goats; (figuratively) breed - kpaa ego = make money (Lit: breed cash); kpaa akii = amass wealth
trade in - kpaa mmanu = trade in oil
act on purpose; act deliberately; be careful. var. kpacara anya
act on purpose; act deliberately; be careful. var. kpacalii anya
choke to death; strangle or clamp to death
move in a manner similar to the flapping of wings - fee kpakakpaka = fly with much flapping of wings
pigeon - nwa kpalakwii = a young pigeon (Gen. 15:9)
walk up and down aimlessly; loiter
disgrace or humiliate somebody in public; insult
scatter; disperse - O kpasala ebo = "scatterer of kindred"
provoke; incite; cause vexation - kpasuo iwe = provoke one to rage; infuriate; kposuo ogu = provoke
remove from a distance with a stick or tong

decide or determine a case or suit; give judgment; make final settlement
bring or into - kpohataya = bring her in
recall; return - kpocighaa ndiegwu = call back the musicians; recall them. var. kpoghaci
nail down - kpode ya n'obe = nailed him to the plank
nail to death; crucify. var. kpogbuo
entities already in a heap; mass; Lit: un-do a heap - kposaa aja = spread out a heap of sand
take last breath; breathe one's last - kue ume = take last breath; die

column5: especially if he is a direct relation; have a [married] woman as concubine

English: (Oka) call; call upon - Nne ya ekue di ya = her mother calls on her husband
(Afikpo) sleep. var. larii ira; raha ira
nurse a baby for a period
column3: usually from one to three years

English: (Ohafia) call a meeting; convene a meeting
(Ohafia) assemble; call together - kuru nde ya biri = assembled the neighbours
hire; secure services of - kuo ndi oru = hire workers
nurse a child to age; nurture; be a baby-sitter for a child

column3: right (as well as food as it is eaten with that hand)

English: (Owere) infant; young child. var. obele nwa; ogbede nwa

chest; upper half of the body above the rib-cage; part of carcass - maa a ikwii n'obi = struck him on the chest with his foot; kenye ha obi ani = give them the torso of the animal as their share; heart (both literally and figuratively)
ending or termination of; final phase of something - obibi ogu = the last phases of the war; obibi okwu = the termination (or settlement) of an issue
residence; dwelling; the act of settling in or dwelling in a place - ulo obibi = dwelling house; house intended to be lived in
the act of touching or imprinting; the making of an impression - obibi akwukwo = the printing of a book
a large bird. var. obu; ovu. See "obo ogwu" = duck
kind of gourd used as a container for small objects
open space in the village used for assembly and other public events. *See "ama ukwu" = village central square

column3: or largest autonomous community with which one is identified; hence
column4: clan - obodo anyi = our country or nation; ijiu obodo = civil (or public) service; nzuko obodo = clan union or assembly; a person's rural and ancestral (as opposed to urban) home - o jere obodo = he went home (i.e. to his ancestral village home); village - ndi obodo = villagers; countryfolk

English: old-style earthen bed; mudbed. var. mkpokpo; mkpoko

column3: arena for village or community gathering; settlement. var. ibom

English: main village hall or meeting place; communal hall used by the extended family. var. obi ama

column4: belonging to a kindred or lineage. var. obi ama. See "igbudu"

English: birthmark; other mark or trait present at birth
(Ohafia) entrance hall to main house; guest room; inner chamber or bedroom. var. obi
(Afikpo) ladder; any scaffolding; rafter post or plank used in house construction and other trades. var. mbe; mbibi; mbibi; mbube; ndubu; obe
(loan) thread from which cloth is woven; sewing thread; cotton wool. var. owu; owulu
small wooden chair; low stool used mostly in the
small wooden chair; low stool used mostly in the kitchen

column3: e.g. palm wine - oci ngwo = one who taps wine (from the raffia palm)

presentation of food to the public at a formal gathering
closure; termination or conclusion; the process of bringing to a close - ihe na-ebute ama ocici = what leads to the termination of a family line
installation or initiation of a person to a title or office; coronation of a chief or "eze"; the act of ordination or initiation into an order
castrated he-goat; eunuch; castrated man. var. okili; okiri
old; aged; ancient - oce ode = old chair; uzo ode = former way or road; experienced - aka ode = old hand; experienced person
clerk; scribe; secretary; one whose responsibility is to keep records - ndi ode akwukwo = the scribes (Mk. 7:5); ode akwukwo obodo = secretary to the government

column4: to mark the return of some ancestors and spirits; masked spirit dancer - or popular masquerade

deep-red colour; purple or wine colour - akwa odo-odo = deep-red cloth (Rev. 18:12)
(Onicha) scorpion; Lit: lord of the wilderness
giant rat; large rat usually found in the garden yard
(Bende) large and soft-shelled variety of beans

column5: sometimes called "yam beans". var. n dudu; ukpo odudu

English: tsetse-fly - jio ka odudu = scamper off hastily as if in fear like the tsetse fly (which usually flies off before it can ever be hit)
lion - odum na-egbu aguu = lion that can kill the tiger. var. odumedu
